constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: NEIPOL Name: MC1  Maldens and Coombe
TPPNT Ref: RBK.04.11Tree ref: T3Tree type: COMM9Description: RBK Order no: 04 Year: 2011
AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: T.1 Oak - Fell. (Beefsteak fungus (Fistulina hepatica)).T.2 Oak - 2-3m Lateral crown reduction of overhang.
decision_conditions: T.1 Oak - 3m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & deadwood.T.2 Oak - 3-4m Holistic crown reduction & reshape to suitable growth points & deadwood.

T.1 There has been no evidence submitted of the degree of decay associated with the Beef Steak Fungus, which is still a small fruiting body in one location and growing within minor bark wounds caused by the severing of ivy historically. The crown still appears healthy and is not showing signs of dieback that would be indicative of more advanced decay. On this basis the removal of the tree is excessive and should be downgraded to a reduction and ongoing annual autumnal monitoring to track the process and remove only when it becomes necessary.

T.2 - A lateral reduction will result in an imbalance of the canopy and the owner of the tree has approached the Council to state they wish to reduce the remainder and will do so with the applicant at the same time using the same company for the work, as such the permission should allow a holistic reduction rather than a lateral reduction in isolation.
Proposed development would require planning permission.

If you have evidence to contradict the local planning authority's assessment of the application, you are encouraged to apply for the development again and include that evidence in support of the application.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

The Lawful Application cannot be a free go.Therefore the fee required for your planning application is £ 129.00.  Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website, via our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002.
For avoidance of doubt, please confirm the description 'Erection of roof extension with rear dormer and installation of 3nos front rooflights.'

The fee required for your planning application is £ 145.00. we acknowledge the receipt of £43.00, please pay the outstanding balanceof £102.00. Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website, via our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002.
